name: Opposite Platformer (namesnotsteve)
description:
A very small platformer. I unfortunately had very limited time to work on the game so I was unable to finish it. The idea is that when you play, the game will randomise various aspects of the game to be opposite to what you expect (eg: controls, gravity, direction of movement, camera, etc.)

Everything is quite dodgily implemented and so things may not work too great. The jumping is awful and frustrating, for instance.

I'll probably expand it and fix it up a bit in future.

Play it if you want, you won't miss out on much, though.

The game was made in unity.
